metadata.title: W3Schools.com
metadata.Keywords: HTML, Python, CSS, SQL, JavaScript, How to, PHP, Java, C, C++, C#, jQuery, Bootstrap, Colors, W3.CSS, XML, MySQL, Icons, NodeJS, React, Graphics, Angular, R, AI, Git, Data Science, Code Game, Tutorials, Programming, Web Development, Training, Learning, Quiz, Exercises, Courses, Lessons, References, Examples, Learn to code, Source code, Demos, Tips, Website
metadata.Description: Well organized and easy to understand Web building tutorials with lots of examples of how to use HTML, CSS, JavaScript, SQL, Python, PHP, Bootstrap, Java, XML and more.
metadata.og:description: W3Schools offers free online tutorials, references and exercises in all the major languages of the web. Covering popular subjects like HTML, CSS, JavaScript, Python, SQL, Java, and many, many more.
metadata.keywords: HTML, Python, CSS, SQL, JavaScript, How to, PHP, Java, C, C++, C#, jQuery, Bootstrap, Colors, W3.CSS, XML, MySQL, Icons, NodeJS, React, Graphics, Angular, R, AI, Git, Data Science, Code Game, Tutorials, Programming, Web Development, Training, Learning, Quiz, Exercises, Courses, Lessons, References, Examples, Learn to code, Source code, Demos, Tips, Website

content.text: The Document Object Model (DOM) defines a standard for accessing and manipulating documents:
content.html: The Document Object Model (DOM) defines a standard for accessing and manipulating documents:

content.text: "The W3C Document Object Model (DOM) is a platform and language-neutral interface that allows programs and scripts to dynamically access and update the content, structure, and style of a document."
content.html: "The W3C Document Object Model (DOM) is a platform and language-neutral interface that allows programs and scripts to dynamically access and update the content, structure, and style of a document."

content.text: The HTML DOM defines a standard way for accessing and manipulating HTML documents. It presents an HTML document as a tree-structure.
content.html: The HTML DOM defines a standard way for accessing and manipulating HTML documents. It presents an HTML document as a tree-structure.

content.text: The XML DOM defines a standard way for accessing and manipulating XML documents. It presents an XML document as a tree-structure.
content.html: The XML DOM defines a standard way for accessing and manipulating XML documents. It presents an XML document as a tree-structure.

content.text: Understanding the DOM is a must for anyone working with HTML or XML.
content.html: Understanding the DOM is a must for anyone working with HTML or XML.

content.text: All HTML elements can be accessed through the HTML DOM.
content.html: All HTML elements can be accessed through the HTML DOM.

content.text: This example changes the value of an HTML element with id="demo":
content.html: This example changes the value of an HTML element with id="demo":

content.code: This is a Heading
content.code_html:
<h1 id="demo">This is a Heading</h1>

<button type="button"
onclick="document.getElementById('demo').innerHTML = 'Hello World!'">Click Me!
</button>

content.text: You can learn a lot more about the HTML DOM in our JavaScript tutorial .
content.html: You can learn a lot more about the HTML DOM in our JavaScript tutorial.

content.text: All XML elements can be accessed through the XML DOM.
content.html: All XML elements can be accessed through the XML DOM.

content.code:
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>

<bookstore>


<book category="cooking">

<title lang="en">Everyday 
Italian</title>
    <author>Giada De Laurentiis</author>
    
<year>2005</year>
    <price>30.00</price>
  </book>


  <book category="children">
    <title lang="en">Harry 
Potter</title>
    <author>J K. Rowling</author>
    
<year>2005</year>
    <price>29.99</price>
  </book>

</bookstore>
content.code_html:
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>
<bookstore>

  <book category="cooking">
    <title lang="en">Everyday Italian</title>
    <author>Giada De Laurentiis</author>
    <year>2005</year>
    <price>30.00</price>
  </book>

  <book category="children">
    <title lang="en">Harry Potter</title>
    <author>J K. Rowling</author>
    <year>2005</year>
    <price>29.99</price>
  </book>

</bookstore>

content.text: This code retrieves the text value of the first <title> element in an XML document:
content.html: This code retrieves the text value of the first <title> element in an XML document:

content.code_html: txt = xmlDoc.getElementsByTagName("title")[0].childNodes[0].nodeValue;

content.text: The XML DOM is a standard for how to get, change, add, and delete XML elements.
content.html: The XML DOM is a standard for how to get, change, add, and delete XML elements.

content.text: This example loads a text string into an XML DOM object, and extracts the info from it with JavaScript:
content.html: This example loads a text string into an XML DOM object, and extracts the info from it with JavaScript:

content.code_html:
<html>
<body>

<p id="demo"></p>

<script>
var text, parser, xmlDoc;

text = "<bookstore><book>" +
"<title>Everyday Italian</title>" +
"<author>Giada De Laurentiis</author>" +
"<year>2005</year>" +
"</book></bookstore>";

parser = new DOMParser();
xmlDoc = parser.parseFromString(text,"text/xml");

document.getElementById("demo").innerHTML =
xmlDoc.getElementsByTagName("title")[0].childNodes[0].nodeValue;
</script>

</body>
</html>

content.text: You will learn a lot more about the XML DOM in our XML DOM Tutorial .
content.html: You will learn a lot more about the XML DOM in our XML DOM Tutorial.
